pr_title: #214 - Better types and more constructors header matchers

timeline.message: #214 - Better types and more constructors in RsHasHeaders and ResponseMatcher
#214 - Better types and more constructors in RsHasHeaders and ResponseMatcher
#214 - Better types and more constructors in RsHasHeaders and ResponseMatcher
#214 - Better types and more constructors in RsHasHeaders and ResponseMatcher

timeline.bodyText: @olegmoz I'd use single order for constructor parameters: now we have status, body, headers and status, headers, body. I think second option would be more correct here.
timeline.author: g4s8
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -39,11 +39,37 @@
 
     /**
      * Ctor.
+     *
      * @param status Expected status
      * @param body Expected body
      * @param headers Expected headers
      */
-    public ResponseMatcher(final RsStatus status, final byte[] body, final Header... headers) {
+    public ResponseMatcher(
+        final RsStatus status,
+        final byte[] body,
+        final Iterable<? extends Map.Entry<String, String>> headers
+    ) {
+        super(
+            new ListOf<Matcher<? super Response>>(
+                new RsHasStatus(status),
+                new RsHasHeaders(headers),
+                new RsHasBody(body)
+            )
+        );
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Ctor.
+     * @param status Expected status
+     * @param body Expected body
+     * @param headers Expected headers
+     */
+    @SafeVarargs
+    public ResponseMatcher(

replies.bodyText: @g4s8 thanks, fixed parameters order for this method
replies.author: olegmoz
